sources.title: Footsteps In The Fog (1955) Stewart Granger, Jean Simmons
sources.description: Footsteps in the Fog is a 1955 British Technicolor FILM NOlR crime film starring real-life husband and wife team, Stewart Granger and Jean Simmons. The screenplay was co-written by Lenore Coffee and Dorothy Davenport. The film is based on the short story "The Interruption" by W. W. Jacobs.   It was shot at Shepperton Studios, with sets designed by the art director Wilfred Shingleton.   You can find out more about this movie from Wikipedia .

metadata.Plot: To his Victorian London friends, Stephen Lowry is a heartbroken widower. Only his housemaid Lily knows that far from dying of gastroenteritis his wife was slowly poisoned by her husband - information she is happy to use to improve her position in the household and to make sure she stays close to Stephen. As his own prospects improve with a business partnership and a romance more of his own class, Stephen decides that Lily must go. Unfortunately for him, his first attempt gives her even more of a hold over him.
metadata.Writer: Dorothy Davenport, Lenore J. Coffee, Arthur Pierson
metadata.Actors: Stewart Granger, Jean Simmons, Bill Travers
